subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






June 11, 2007

TOP STORIESGeorgia Judge Voids Teen Sex Sentence
A Georgia judge ordered the release of a man sentenced to 10 years in prison for having consensual oral sex with a 15-year-old
                        girl when he was 17. He instead gave Genarlow Wilson a 12-month misdemeanor sentence with credit for time already served. More...Watch: Genarlow Wilson To Be Released
• Court Rebuffs Bush On Enemy Combatants• S.C. Court Rejects Killer's Zoloft Defense• Searchers Seek Soldier Missing For 3 Days
                     					| WatchU.S.Court Rebuffs Bush On Enemy Combatants
A divided federal appeals court ruled that the Bush administration cannot legally detain a U.S. resident it believes is an
                        al Qaeda agent without charge and must allow him to be released from military detention. More...
• Searchers Seek Soldier Missing For 3 Days
                     					| Watch• Cops: Domestic Dispute Caused Wisc. Deaths
                     					| Watch• High Court Bolsters Anti-Pollution Program• More StoriesWorld3 GIs Killed In Baghdad Bridge Blast
A car bomb brought down a section of bridge over a highway south of Baghdad yesterday, killing three soldiers, wounding six
                        and blocking traffic on Iraq's main north-south artery. Meanwhile, former Sunni foes are being asked to help fight al Qaeda. More...Watch: 82nd Airborne Heads To Iraq 
• U.S. Chummy With Sudan Despite Darfur?
                     					| Watch• Two Red Cross Workers Killed In Lebanon• Bandits Jeopardize Darfur Lifelines• More StoriesPoliticsSenate Set to Vote On Gonzales
Arlen Specter, the top Republican on the Senate Judiciary Committee, says he will vote for a no-confidence resolution against
                        Attorney General Alberto Gonzales. The measure isn't expected to pass, but few senators are rushing to defend Gonzales. More...Watch: Senate Set For Gonzales Vote
• Thompson Shakes Up GOP Race
                     					| Watch• Bush Undaunted On Immigration, Gonzales
                     					| Watch• Congress' Goal: A Clean, Green Capitol• More StoriesHealthCeliac Disease Clue Found
Gene studies link celiac disease to a defective immune signal. Celiac disease is a digestive disease sometimes called celiac
                        sprue or gluten-sensitive enteropathy.  More...
• Autistic Child's Parents Get Day In Court• S.C. Court Rejects Killer's Zoloft Defense• Which Is Cleaner, Toilet Or Fountain?• More StoriesSciTechSony Assailed Over Cathedral War Game
The Church of England has threatened to sue Sony for using turning Manchester Cathedral into a war zone in a popular video
                        game for PlayStation 3. Sony denies the allegation, saying the game takes place in a "mythical" reality. More...Watch: 'Resistance: Fall of Man'
• Congress' Goal: A Clean, Green Capitol• Have QWERTY, Will Travel• High Court Bolsters Anti-Pollution Program• More StoriesBusinessCEOs Rake In Sky-High Perks, Too
Even as their pay has soared, CEOs continue to receive cushy perks, from personal trips on the corporate jet or yacht to country-club
                        fees and home alarm systems. Many companies pick up the tab for the taxes on those extras, too. More...Watch: Debate Over CEO Pay
• A Silver Lining On High Gas Prices?
                     					| Watch• Estate Planning 101 For Same-Sex Couples• High Court Bolsters Anti-Pollution Program• More StoriesEntertainmentMontana Officials Hunt Letterman Plotter 
A prison inmate accused of plotting to kidnap David Letterman's young son is on the loose after he and another man escaped
                        the Montana State Prison ranch in a truck. More...
• Was This Really It For "Sopranos?"
                     					| Watch• Gore Convinced Peppers To Play Live Earth• The Showbuzz Weekly Forecast• More StoriesOpinionPutting Senators On The Spot
Don't bet the Senate will hold scandal-plagued Attorney General Alberto Gonzales to account, says the Nation. The real
                        issue will be holding senators to account.  More...Watch: Senate Set For Gonzales Vote
• Rudy's Unconventional Bid
                     					| Watch• Graham's Crusade Saved America
                     					| Watch• Wolfowitz Redux?
                     					| Watch• More StoriesCBS NEWS BROADCASTSShowBuzz: People In Hot Water: Paris : God Has Given Me "New Chance"
In her first interview from behind bars, Paris Hilton says God has given her a "new chance" and that her ordeal has inspired
                        her to make a difference. More...Watch: Paris Busy Behind Bars

Cop Sideswiped On HighwayCBS News RAW:  Police in South Carolina are looking for a reckless driver who sideswiped one of their officers while
                                    on a routine traffic stop near Greenville.
